title: Can't sign into Google Account. Search is not working properly. Rest of the sites work fine
content:
Anything related to google services does not work. I can't sign into Google Account. Trying to sign into Gmail or drive also doesn't work. I get this 400 error everytime trying to sign in to google (screenshot).

Google search sometimes work. sometime doesn't work. google search from the new tab address bar works fine but subsequent searches do not work.

I am on windows 11. Latest Firefox version. These are working fine on other browsers.

so far, I have tried:

  • clearing cookies and History
  • started in safe mode
  • started in private window
  • removed every extension and themes
  • fresh installed again.

title: How to delete credit card auto-fill data in Firefox for EUROPE-ean users?
content:
Hello!

So recently I made a purchase via a website with my credit card. Was a one time purchase and I want the credit card data to be deleted, but it keeps auto filling the form even after I deleted all cookies, browser history, cache and everything else. I searched forums that there is auto-fill credit card & address options but only in US and Canada and I am in Europe.

How do I delete this data stored in Firefox since it keeps auto-filling it even after I contacted the billing support to delete my information.

Thanks!

title: ¿Como puedo recuperar una parte del historial de Firefox que he borrado por error?
content:
Buenos días a todos.


Estaba revisando el historial de navegación de mi Firefox desde el menú Historial/Mostrar todo el historial. Como ya sabéis, para movernos por el historial tenemos de ayuda un menu vertical a la izquierda, en el cual podemos seleccionar un determinado mes. Pero por error he eliminado la carpeta que decía "anterior a 6 meses" y me gustaría recuperarla.

Tengo entendido que Firefox guarda el historial de navegacion en el fichero places.sqlite, el cual ya tengo ubicado, pero no se qué hacer con el.

Agradezco cualquier ayuda. Gracias.
creator: trentinoembajador

title: 115.0.3 on macOS 13.5 failing to complete authentication with FIDO2 Security Key
content:
I've been attempting to use FIDO2 w/ PIN support to log into Okta. This occurs with a pre-registered security key (Yubikey 5C NFC on most recent firmware) that has a PIN already configured. This key works on all other browsers and devices without trouble. Firefox is unresponsive to Yubikey interaction after the notice "Touch your security key to continue with <company>.okta.com" and will eventually time out if I do not cancel.

On the other hand, I can register a new security key on Okta through Firefox on this device. When I go through the registration workflow, Firefox is responsive to all interactions, allowing me to enter my PIN and complete registration.

I have been able to replicate this issue on other computers and with a different user / security key.
creator: clinton.campbell
